description: Redstone signals can be &dinverted&r using &3Redstone Torches&r. While the block a redstone torch is &3attached to&r is &3powered&r, the &dtorch will turn off&r.
&3Repeaters&r can be &3locked&r by &3strongly powering&r them from the side, &dholding their output state&r.
With an &3input&r and &3side&r signal, &3Comparators&r will &donly output power&r when the &3input&r has the higher &3power level&r.
When toggled with &6Right-Click&r, a &3Comparator&r will subtract the highest &3side power level&r from the &3input power level&r.
&ePistons&r with &eRedstone&r or other blocks can be used and collided to create &dbasic blocking/locking logic&r.
These elements can be combined to create &dredstone logic&r (e.g. &3AND&r and &3OR&r gates), which can provide &dcomplex control for advanced mechanisms&r.
